TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The responded Government were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG and , subsequently , PERSON , Acting Government Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant owns a flower shop in LOC . On DATE the applicant parked his car in an unauthorized place . He was stopped by the municipal police officers while he was transporting flowers and QUANTITY of soil to his shop . The police officers proposed the applicant to pay ORG MONEY as a fine for parking in an unauthorized place . The applicant refused to pay the fine and , consequently , in accordance with the law then in force , the municipal police officers lodged a motion for punishment of the applicant by ORG ( PERSON do PERSON ) .
On DATE the municipal police requested ORG to punish the applicant for a petty offence of illegal parking .
The hearings listed for DATE and for DATE by ORG were adjourned due to the absence of the municipal police officers .
At the hearing held on DATE ORG heard a municipal police officer in the presence of the applicant .
By a decision of DATE ORG imposed a fine of PLN CARDINAL on the applicant for illegal parking of his car .

The applicant appealed against this decision , claiming that he could not transport the commodity in a different manner , especially the flowers , without exposing them to damage during DATE . He alleged that the municipality did not provide any other possibility of parking which could allow him to run his business .
On DATE the applicant ’s appeal and the case - fine was transmitted to ORG for examination .
On DATE the president of the court listed a hearing for DATE .

On DATE the applicant was duly summoned to the hearing . As transpires from an acknowledgment of receipt , on DATE the applicant ’s apartment was closed . Thus , the postman left him a written notice on the door of his apartment to collect the summons at the post office . The summons was not collected by the applicant by DATE and consequently , it was returned to the court with a note that it was not collected by the applicant within the prescribed time - limit of DATE .

By a judgment in default of CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld the contested decision . Neither the applicant nor a prosecutor was present at the hearing . The court noted in the records of the case that the applicant was duly summoned to the hearing .
On DATE the applicant had been served with the judgment . He confirmed this fact with his own signature .

In a letter of DATE he requested to be served with the written grounds of the judgment . He also contended that the proceedings were not fair as he had not been informed of or summoned to the hearing on DATE and therefore his arguments could not have been adequately presented to the court . He asked the court for the explanation and redress of this procedural shortcoming .
By a letter of ORG of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant was informed that the judgment was final and no appeal lay against it .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE to the President of ORG , the applicant explained that on DATE he had been served with the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . He had also been informed that he could request the written grounds within DATE time - limit . He had done so in his letter of DATE .

On DATE the court decided that the applicant should pay the costs of the proceedings in amount of PLN CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision . On DATE ORG decided to uphold the contested decision .

By a letter of DATE the President of ORG informed the applicant that he could not appeal against the contested judgment as it had already become final , but that he could have the written grounds prepared .

On DATE the applicant lodged a new complaint with ORG that he was not summoned to the hearing and he had not presented his arguments . He also alleged that he had repeatedly requested the written grounds of the judgment and the explanation in respect of the summons to the hearing , but all his requests remained unanswered . ORG

Following the applicant ’s further request of CARDINAL DATE , the court sent him the written grounds of the judgment on DATE . The court emphasised therein , inter alia , that the applicant could have used a parking place located QUANTITY away from the place where he had illegally parked his car .

At the material time the rules concerning a police order to pay a fine were defined in the Ordinance of ORG of DATE on imposition , payment and execution of fines imposed by an order of an appropriate organ ( rozporządzenie PERSON w sprawie nakładania , uiszczania i ściągania grzywien w postępowaniu mandatowym- PERSON , or ORG , of DATE , CARDINAL , Item CARDINAL ) . Pursuant to § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW in the proceedings concerning imposition of a fine , an appropriate organ may order a fine payable immediately in cash only if the amount of this fine does not exceed LAW . Pursuant to LAW ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW , imposition of a fine in such proceedings is possible only if a person punished by a fine accepts it . In case of refusal , the police or municipal police are obliged to submit a motion for punishment of such a person to ORG .

Under LAW in connection with LAW DATE ( ORG ) , applicable to the judicial proceedings concerning minor offences in which a decision was given by ORG , the provisions concerning the criminal summary proceedings shall be applicable .

At the material time the rules concerning service of summons in criminal proceedings were defined in LAW ORG . Pursuant to LAW , if a personal summoning of an addressee is impossible , a summons sent by the post should be left at the post office located the nearest to the addressee . According to LAW ORG , the addressee should be informed about the summons left at the post office by a written notice left on the door of his / her home . The notice should inform the addressee that the summons should be taken up within DATE .

According to well - established jurisprudence of ORG , a party in criminal proceedings shall not be allowed to claim that it was not summoned by a court while being informed about a summons and not collecting it from an indicated place ( see a decision of ORG of DATE , III ORG DATE , published in OSNKW No . CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL , Item CARDINAL ) .

LAW , applicable to the summary proceedings , provided that if a suspect , who was served with the summons to the hearing , did not attend the hearing , the court could hold the hearing in the absence of the suspect and a judgment in default could be given .
